intro: Crotalaria astragalina subsp. onobrychis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, open habitats. It has been used traditionally in some regions for its medicinal properties. Its seeds are also a food source for certain bird species.
